data.name: DocumentSecurityMessage
data.value: SQLClue Automation Controller start-up account access must be granted to enable automated synchronization between a document and the SQLClue Runbook. Verify the access requirement listed or forward this information to the security authority or SQLClue Administrator [{0}] before commiting this Runbook Topic action.

data.name: SetupNoServersMessage
data.value: SQLClue has not been able to detect any local SQL Server instances. This may be because the SQL Browser Service is not running. It may also be an indication that SQL Server is not installed on the local system. [{0}] requires a pre-existing local SQL Server. Select [OK] to continue and enter the name of an existing local SQL Instance. Select [Cancel] to exit and quit this request to run [{0}].

data.name: ArchiveConfigurationTreeTitle
data.value: Configuration from [{0}] to Include in Archive

data.name: ArchiveNotificationOperatorRequired
data.value: A SQL Agent Operator must be properly configured before Alert Notifications can be enabled and sent.

data.name: StringAdvOptionsHelp
data.value: Text entry field that allows you to enter [{0}] value for this setting.

data.name: RepositoryInstallPromtpt
data.value:
It is recommended that the SQL Server DDL and Configuration Repository database is installed when SQLClue is installed. It is to the advantage of most users to respond [Yes]. Unless only the SQLClue Compare component is desired – an unlikely first use yet entirely appropriate supplemental configuration, the creation of this database is required by SQLClue. For script details see file [{0}] at {1})
HOST SQL SERVER REQUIREMENTS A user specified local SQL Server 2005 instance will host the Repository. The SQL instance must be installed before the repository can be installed. A new or existing database can be specified. If a new database name is specified, the setup routine will use the SQL instance defaults when creating the database. To control the database creation, simply specify an existing database in the Setup connection dialog. Enable the CLR on the host SQL instance by executing the following T-SQL command and then restarting the SQL Server service.
EXEC sp_configure ‘clr enabled’, 1 RECONFIGURE
DATABASE ROLE BASED SECURITY The script will create three roles in the database:
SQLClueAdminRole SQLClueServiceRole SQLClueReportingRole
Place users that will use the SQLClue application to plan and administer Repository archival activities in the SQLClueAdminRole. Assign the SQLClueService service account to the SQLClueServiceRole. Add all users that might access data through Reporting Services or other read only interfaces to the archive through the SQLClueReportingRole's stored procedures.
If [No] is selected at this time, Repository setup can be restarted from the [Tools] menu option at any time. This menu option can also be used at anytime to modify the connection information to the Repository.

data.name: CompareHTMLScrollerJavaScript
CompareHTML
data.value: <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd"> <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"> <head><title>SQLClue Compare</title></head> <frameset cols="100%" rows="10%,80%,10%" frameborder="1"> <frame src="SQLClueTitle.htm" scrolling="no" name="top"> <frameset cols="50%,50%" rows="100%" frameborder="1"> <frame src="SQLClueResultsA.htm" scrolling="yes" name="left"> <frame src="SQLClueResultsB.htm" scrolling="yes" name="right"> </frameset> <frame src="SQLClueKey.htm" scrolling="no" name="bottom"> <noframes><body> A browser that supports HTML Frames is required. </body></noframes></frameset></html>

data.name: ArchiveSuccessNotificationName
data.comment: needs to match name in SQL script

data.name: SplashMsg
data.value: Enumerating Servers... If this operation is taking too long or not providing a complete list of servers, try changing the [Server Enum Scope] in the Compare form [Advanced Settings]

data.name: OnlyLicenceIfDBInstalled
data.value: The SQL Configuration Repository must be installed before SQLClue can be licensed. Use the SQL Configuration Repository option of the Tools Menu to install the component. It is also recommended that an archive of the host SQL Instance be completed before licensing to verify the installation.

data.name: ServiceSetupMessage
data.value:
You must be a local administrator on host {0} to install the Automation Controller service.
The installer requires you to enter a Windows user name and password for use as the Windows service start-up account
The Service start-up account will be added to the [sysadmin] Fixed Server Role on targeted SQL Server instances that use where SQLClue is configured to connect using Windows authentication.
Monitor the Application Event Log on the host for all event messages from source '{1}'.
See the Automation Controller help for additional considerations and guidelines.

data.name: ExceptionInfoMsg
data.value: For more information or support for this error see http://www.bwunder.com or email Bill at bwunder@yahoo.com.

data.name: ArchiveNotificationNoSQLExpress
data.value: Alert Notifications not supported on SQL Server Expresss

data.name: NoRepositoryServerNodes
data.value: No Servers found in local Repository

data.name: SQLLoginNotRecommendedText
data.value: Windows Authentication is recommended. SQL Server Authentication is provided for your convenience for situations where it is may not possible to use Windows authentication. The SQL password may be stored in clear text in the app.config file. Great care should be used to assure that no unwanted access is provided to this file. The password is also exposed as clear text on the wire. Use the 'Encrypted Connection' option to prevent exposing the password to network sniffers and other whippersnappers. If an SSL certificate is not installed, use the 'Trust Server Certificate' to allow the target SQL Server to generate a certificate for on the wire encryption.

data.name: RepositoryCorrupt
data.value: SQL Configuration Repository appears to be corrupted or has been previously uninstalled. The setup dialog will be populated with cached values for the existing Configuration Repository. Use these values to reconnect to the existing data store or provide connection information to another database/server if preferred.

data.name: EvtNotifyDropFailed
data.value: SQL Instance [{0}] is not available. SQLClue Event Notification configuration cannot be removed from the target instance at this time. To prevent an out of space condition in the future have a DBA execute the 'uninstSQLClueDDLEventNotifications.sql' script from the SQLClue Resources Library in database [{1}] on target [{0}] when the SQL Server is available.

data.name: ServiceLoginDropFailed
data.value: Failed to remove the SQL Server login from Instance [{0}] for the SQLClue Automation Controller service account [{1}]. Remove the login when the SQL Server is available.
